comment: There's no lecturing or anything from her end. It's just group projects and weekly connect assignments. The group projects were sometimes tricky because of the vague directions and since she was VERY unresponsive it made things harder. She was okay and I recommend taking her if she's the only option

The course is just completing weekly connect assignments with the occasional D2L quiz. There are no exams. Groups are randomly assigned for the project, and it involves generating a lengthy report and presentation about a specific industry that your group chooses. Feedback on the project is nonexistent, so follow the instructions very carefully.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Take this class!!!!! You won't regret it, it's the easiest A you can earn. All of the material is super easy to comprehend and she will help you if you need it. Her only flaw is that it SOMETIMES can take a while for her to respond. At the end she gives extra credit and unlocks any assignment you might've missed. PLEASE TAKE HER! SHES AWESOME!
She doesn't make it easy to access the homework. She also gives 30 minute timed assignments (with one attempt each) every week, some are 40+ questions, with articles, and reading... in 30 minutes.

Best Prof I have ever taken.  Very clear on what you need to know.  She has a very strong accent but she speaks very clear.  Attendance is mandatory.  Guest speaker had one of the most inspirational messages ever.  She likes to give and take so be prepared to interact as she will go down the role and ask questions and that is your attendance.

You will get a good grade if you do the assignments, pay attention and read. She explains what will be on the exams and how to prepare. Tough grader, but also gives opportunities to pick up easy points through group projects and quizzes on guest lecturers. All in all good experience, I would take her again.

I enjoyed this class and thought that professor Ayeni was good at explaining the material and how to become an entrepreneur in todays world. Very interesting class and would 100% take this professor again.

Constantly asked us to refer to the syllabus when we asked questions. End of semester project was suddenly due a week earlier than what was listed on the syllabus. Incredibly rude in emails. Her expectations are generally outrageous for what youre supposed to be doing which are exaggerated by her awful communication. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: There were 3 tests, 1 quiz, 1 group project, and 2 papers. Overall the assignments were very easy. The way she speaks is confusing but she is always willing to work with you and provide clarity. Tests are online and at home; class will be canceled for that day. Attendance is taken tually really helped my grade (125/1000 pts.) I would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Probably the worst teacher at Kennesaw that I have taken. Takes over a month long to grade each test. Doesnt believe in giving anyone a 100, not even on peer evaluations. Very specific on every paper, wrong format  zero %. She doesnt know how to teach other than reading from her powerpoints word-for-word. She is a complete waste of your learning

Not the best professor I've taken but if you give her a chance, you'll see that she isn't bad. Unclear at times with feedback and seemingly expects word for word responses from the book. She can be engaging if the class is involved. The course is not bad and you can get an A. Don't expect to be given anything though, you have to earn it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a very tough grader and is unclear on how she grades, she also takes an extremely long time to return grades. Her lectures are mind numbing and attendance is mandatory. Students started lecturing mid-way through the semester for some dumb reason making class feel pointless. Unnecessarily hard group project as well. Yikes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's not horrible, but she isn't great. Lectures are extremely boring- she literally reads from her power points. 3 at home tests & 3 pop quiz essays (2 page long perfectly written essays in 15mins) She also decided to let us know mid-semester that it was a "requirement" for us to teach the class a chapter. Unclear on everything.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Worst teacher I have ever had by far. I suggest trying to get another teacher if possible otherwise you will have a tough semester. Takes too long to grade papers. Grades harshly on essays and makes the class teach half her lectures. DO NOT TAKE!

The curriculum is based on pop quizzes, a team project, and tests. Tests are online & from book. PP's alone won't do. Rude over email. Tough grader. Expects you to know exactly what she wants. Students teach most of the class. Attendance mandatory. I do not recommend. Got an A but did not learn a thing
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: HORRIBLE! According to the University final grades were due 6 hours ago and she has yet to enter them. Doesn't give back grades for at LEAST a month or more, even if its a completion grade. Doesn't teach, just reads powerpoint slides. Grades very harshly and fails you if its not word for word from the textbook. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! She is the worst professor I have EVER had. Her "teaching" is her reading 20- 30 slides a class, thats if she "teaches". Half of the time she makes students read the slides and she sits in the back of the class. Doesn't give grades back for at least a month after taking. Grades assignments HARSHLY. Obviously a adjunct professor
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: One of the most frustrating professor I've ever had. She didn't update the grade book until one month before finals, so had no idea where you stood in the class(Graded wrong) Horrible with technology, she struggled to turn on the computer and sound. She's very nice but you can defiantly tell that she doesn't know what she's talking about or doing.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
